result.execSummary:
The defendant John L. Koplin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John L. Koplin

records.addlTxt: Transcript, Plea & Sentencing, 4-20-22
Associated with Charge #2

Clerk Amy. 
Case called:  3:44 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person/in custody from MCJ with Atty Heather Roehr. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

State moves to DRI Count 1 (Possess w/Intent/Deliver Narcotics/Repeater), Count 4 (Carry Concealed Weapon/Repeater), Count 5 (Possession of THC/Repeater) and Count 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to Count 2 (Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  
PLEA to Count 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater):  NO CONTEST.  

COURT ORDERS on each count:  3 years prison (1.5 years IC/1.5 years ES); concurrent with each other and sentence currently serving, including any revocation.   

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.   Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  COURT grants 35 days credit.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. 

Adj:  4:00 p.m.

BOTR:  4:03 p.m. 
Same appearances.  
ADA Coonen states there is a change on sentence credit and states for the record. 
COURT amends JOC to 27 days credit. 

Adj:  4:03 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

PLEA>> NOT GUILTY.
